missing required declarations or has wrong types.\\\\\\\\n- Test comptime code paths with &#96;comptime { ... }&#96; blocks in tests.\\\\\\\\n- Keep comptime logic in dedicated helper functions, not inline in wrapper code.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Parameter System\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nParameters follow nih-plug's model:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Declared as comptime data: name, ID (stable string hash), range, default, step count, unit label, flags.\\\\\\\\n- The framework generates metadata arrays at comptime for both CLAP and VST3.\\\\\\\\n- Smoothing is optional and built-in (linear ramp, exponential). Plugin authors opt in per-parameter.\\\\\\\\n- Sample-accurate automation (buffer splitting at parameter change points) is opt-in via a flag.\\\\\\\\n- Thread safety: main-thread vs. audio-thread parameter arrays. For VST3, processorâ†”controller communication uses message passing.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Buffer and Event Abstractions\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Buffer** provides three iteration strategies:\\\\\\\\n- Per-sample, per-channel (simple plugins, per-sample SIMD).\\\\\\\\n- Per-block, per-channel (FFT, convolution).\\\\\\\\n- Raw slice access (&#96;[][]f32&#96;) for maximum control.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWrappers copy pointers, **never audio data**, from format-specific buffers into the framework &#96;Buffer&#96;.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**NoteEvent** is a tagged union unifying CLAP and VST3 events:\\\\\\\\n- &#96;note_on&#96;, &#96;note_off&#96;, &#96;choke&#96;, &#96;poly_pressure&#96;, &#96;note_expression&#96;, &#96;midi_cc&#96;, etc.\\\\\\\\n- All events carry sample-accurate timestamps (sample offset within the process block).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## File and Module Organization\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nFollow this project structure:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nsrc/\\\\\\\\n  core/              # Framework core (API-agnostic)\\\\\\\\n    \\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"signatures\\\\\\\":{},\\\\\\\"detailedLines\\\\\\\":[{\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"- The framework validates these at comptime using &#96;@hasDecl&#96; The idea is to have a stateful yet simple plugin\\\\\\\\nAPI that gets rid of as much unnecessary ceremony wherever possible, while also\\\\\\\\nkeeping the amount of magic to minimum and making it easy to experiment with\\\\\\\\ndifferent approaches to things. Documentation is still a work in progress. The best way to learn right now is to browse through\\\\\\\\n//! the examples and to browse through these docs. There is no full guide yet, but here are some\\\\\\\\n//! pointers to get started:\\\\\\\\n//!\\\\\\\\n//! - All useful functionality is exported through the [&#96;prelude&#96;] module. Add\\\\\\\\n//!   &#96;use nih_plug::prelude::*;&#96; to the top of your &#96;lib.rs&#96; file to get started.\\\\\\\\n//! - Make sure to check out the macros from the [&#96;debug&#96;] module. These should be used instead of,\\\\\\\\n//!   &#96;println!()&#96;/&#96;eprint!()&#96;, &#96;dbg!()&#96; and similar macros, and they are re-exported from the\\\\\\\\n//!   prelude. NIH-plug sets up a flexible logger for you that all of these functions will output\\\\\\\\n//!   to. By default, the output is logged to STDERR unless you're running Windows and a Windows\\\\\\\\n//!   debugger is attached, in which case the output is logged to the debug console instead. The\\\\\\\\n//!   &#96;NIH_LOG&#96; environment variable controls whether output is logged to STDERR, the Windows debug\\\\\\\\n//!   console, or to a file. Check the [&#96;nih_log!()&#96;] macro for more information.\\\\\\\\n//! - The aforementioned debug module also contains non-fatal debug-assertions macros that are only\\\\\\\\n//!   evaluated during debug builds. The framework uses these all over the place to check for\\\\\\\\n//!   invariants, so it's important to test your plugins using debug builds while developing.\\\\\\\\n//! - Check out the features list in NIH-plug's &#96;Cargo.toml&#96; file for optional features you can\\\\\\\\n//!   enable. This includes things like SIMD support for the buffer adapters and panicking on\\\\\\\\n//!   allocations during DSP code in debug mode.\\\\\\\\n//!\\\\\\\\n//! - An NIH-plug plugin consists of an implementation of the [&#96;Plugin&#96;][prelude::Plugin] trait and\\\\\\\\n//!   a call to [&#96;nih_export_vst3!()&#96;] and/or [&#96;nih_export_clap!()&#96;] in your &#96;lib.rs&#96; file to expose\\\\\\\\n//!   the plugin functionality. Some of these traits will require you to implement an additional\\\\\\\\n//!   trait containing API-specific information for the plugin.\\\\\\\\n//!\\\\\\\\n//!   Check the &#96;Plugin&#96; trait's documentation for more information on NIH-plug's general structure\\\\\\\\n//!   and approach with respect to declarativity.\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"signatures\\\\\\\":{},\\\\\\\"detailedLines\\\\\\\":[{\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"//! Not relevant for real-time audio anyway.\\\\\\\\n- **New I/O interfaces** â€” Use &#96;std.io.AnyReader&#96; / &#96;std.io.AnyWriter&#96; from 0.15.2. std = @import(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"std\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\");\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n// Although this function looks imperative, it does not perform the build\\\\\\\\n// directly and instead it mutates the build graph (&#96;b&#96;) that will be then\\\\\\\\n// executed by an external runner. The functions in &#96;std.Build&#96; implement a DSL\\\\\\\\n// for defining build steps and express dependencies between them, allowing the\\\\\\\\n// build runner to parallelize the build automatically (and the cache system to\\\\\\\\n// know when a step doesn't need to be re-run).\\\\\\\\npub fn build(b: *std.Build) void {\\\\\\\\n    // Standard target options allow the person running &#96;zig build&#96; to choose\\\\\\\\n    // what target to build for. Here we do not override the defaults, which\\\\\\\\n    // means any target is allowed, and the default is native. Other options\\\\\\\\n    // for restricting supported target set are available.\\\\\\\\n    const target = b.standardTargetOptions(.{});\\\\\\\\n    // Standard optimization options allow the person running &#96;zig build&#96; to select\\\\\\\\n    // between Debug, ReleaseSafe, ReleaseFast, and ReleaseSmall. Here we do not\\\\\\\\n    // set a preferred release mode, allowing the user to decide how to optimize.\\\\\\\\n    const optimize = b.standardOptimizeOption(.{});\\\\\\\\n    // It's also possible to define more custom flags to toggle optional features\\\\\\\\n    // of this build script using &#96;b.option()&#96;. All defined flags (including\\\\\\\\n    // target and optimize options) will be listed when running &#96;zig build --help&#96;\\\\\\\\n    // in this directory.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Low-level bindings modules for CLAP and VST3\\\\\\\\n    const clap_bindings = b.addModule(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"clap-bindings\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", .{\\\\\\\\n        .root_source_file = b.path(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"src/bindings/clap/main.zig\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"),\\\\\\\\n        .target = target,\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    const vst3_bindings = b.addModule(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"vst3-bindings\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", .{\\\\\\\\n        .root_source_file = b.path(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"src/bindings/vst3/root.zig\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"),\\\\\\\\n        .target = target,\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Main framework module\\\\\\\\n    const mod = b.addModule(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", .{\\\\\\\\n        .root_source_file = b.path(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"src/root.zig\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"),\\\\\\\\n        .target = target,\\\\\\\\n        .imports = &amp;.{\\\\\\\\n            .{ .name = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"clap-bindings\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", .module = clap_bindings },\\\\\\\\n            .{ .name = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"vst3-bindings\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", .module = vst3_bindings },\\\\\\\\n        },\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Here we define an executable. An executable needs to have a root module\\\\\\\\n    // which needs to expose a &#96;main&#96; function. While we could add a main function\\\\\\\\n    // to the module defined above, it's sometimes preferable to split business\\\\\\\\n    // logic and the CLI into two separate modules.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // If your goal is to create a Zig library for others to use, consider if\\\\\\\\n    // it might benefit from also exposing a CLI tool. A parser library for a\\\\\\\\n    // data serialization format could also bundle a CLI syntax checker, for example.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // If instead your goal is to create an executable, consider if users might\\\\\\\\n    // be interested in also being able to embed the core functionality of your\\\\\\\\n    // program in their own executable in order to avoid the overhead involved in\\\\\\\\n    // subprocessing your CLI tool.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // If neither case applies to you, feel free to delete the declaration you\\\\\\\\n    // don't need and to put everything under a single module.\\\\\\\\n    const exe = b.addExecutable(.{\\\\\\\\n        .name = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\\n        .root_module = b.createModule(.{\\\\\\\\n            // b.createModule defines a new module just like b.addModule but,\\\\\\\\n            // unlike b.addModule, it does not expose the module to consumers of\\\\\\\\n            // this package, which is why in this case we don't have to give it a name.\\\\\\\\n            .root_source_file = b.path(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"src/main.zig\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"),\\\\\\\\n            // Target and optimization levels must be explicitly wired in when\\\\\\\\n            // defining an executable or library (in the root module), and you\\\\\\\\n            // can also hardcode a specific target for an executable or library\\\\\\\\n            // definition if desireable (e.g. firmware for embedded devices).\\\\\\\\n            .target = target,\\\\\\\\n            .optimize = optimize,\\\\\\\\n            // List of modules available for import in source files part of the\\\\\\\\n            // root module.\\\\\\\\n            .imports = &amp;.{\\\\\\\\n                // Here \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" is the name you will use in your source code to\\\\\\\\n                // import this module (e.g. &#96;@import(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")&#96;). The name is\\\\\\\\n                // repeated because you are allowed to rename your imports, which\\\\\\\\n                // can be extremely useful in case of collisions (which can happen\\\\\\\\n                // importing modules from different packages).\\\\\\\\n                .{ .name = \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"z_plug\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", .module = mod },\\\\\\\\n            },\\\\\\\\n        }),\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // This declares intent for the executable to be installed into the\\\\\\\\n    // install prefix when running &#96;zig build&#96; (i.e. when executing the default\\\\\\\\n    // step). By default the install prefix is &#96;zig-out/&#96; but can be overridden\\\\\\\\n    // by passing &#96;--prefix&#96; or &#96;-p&#96;.\\\\\\\\n    b.installArtifact(exe);\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // This creates a top level step. Top level steps have a name and can be\\\\\\\\n    // invoked by name when running &#96;zig build&#96; (e.g. &#96;zig build run&#96;).\\\\\\\\n    // This will evaluate the &#96;run&#96; step rather than the default step.\\\\\\\\n    // For a top level step to actually do something, it must depend on other\\\\\\\\n    // steps (e.g. a Run step, as we will see in a moment).\\\\\\\\n    const run_step = b.step(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"run\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Run the app\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\");\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // This creates a RunArtifact step in the build graph. A RunArtifact step\\\\\\\\n    // invokes an executable compiled by Zig. Steps will only be executed by the\\\\\\\\n    // runner if invoked directly by the user (in the case of top level steps)\\\\\\\\n    // or if another step depends on it, so it's up to you to define when and\\\\\\\\n    // how this Run step will be executed. In our case we want to run it when\\\\\\\\n    // the user runs &#96;zig build run&#96;, so we create a dependency link.\\\\\\\\n    const run_cmd = b.addRunArtifact(exe);\\\\\\\\n    run_step.dependOn(&amp;run_cmd.step);\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // By making the run step depend on the default step, it will be run from the\\\\\\\\n    // installation directory rather than directly from within the cache directory.\\\\\\\\n    run_cmd.step.dependOn(b.getInstallStep());\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // This allows the user to pass arguments to the application in the build\\\\\\\\n    // command itself, like this: &#96;zig build run -- arg1 arg2 etc&#96;\\\\\\\\n    if (b.args) |args| {\\\\\\\\n        run_cmd.addArgs(args);\\\\\\\\n    }\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Creates an executable that will run &#96;test&#96; blocks from the provided module.\\\\\\\\n    // Here &#96;mod&#96; needs to define a target, which is why earlier we made sure to\\\\\\\\n    // set the releative field.\\\\\\\\n    const mod_tests = b.addTest(.{\\\\\\\\n        .root_module = mod,\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Test the CLAP bindings\\\\\\\\n    const clap_tests = b.addTest(.{\\\\\\\\n        .root_module = clap_bindings,\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Test the VST3 bindings\\\\\\\\n    const vst3_tests = b.addTest(.{\\\\\\\\n        .root_module = vst3_bindings,\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // A run step that will run the test executable.\\\\\\\\n    const run_mod_tests = b.addRunArtifact(mod_tests);\\\\\\\\n    const run_clap_tests = b.addRunArtifact(clap_tests);\\\\\\\\n    const run_vst3_tests = b.addRunArtifact(vst3_tests);\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Creates an executable that will run &#96;test&#96; blocks from the executable's\\\\\\\\n    // root module. Note that test executables only test one module at a time,\\\\\\\\n    // hence why we have to create two separate ones.\\\\\\\\n    const exe_tests = b.addTest(.{\\\\\\\\n        .root_module = exe.root_module,\\\\\\\\n    });\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // A run step that will run the second test executable.\\\\\\\\n    const run_exe_tests = b.addRunArtifact(exe_tests);\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // A top level step for running all tests. dependOn can be called multiple\\\\\\\\n    // times and since the two run steps do not depend on one another, this will\\\\\\\\n    // make the two of them run in parallel.\\\\\\\\n    const test_step = b.step(\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"test\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\", \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Run tests\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\");\\\\\\\\n    test_step.dependOn(&amp;run_mod_tests.step);\\\\\\\\n    test_step.dependOn(&amp;run_clap_tests.step);\\\\\\\\n    test_step.dependOn(&amp;run_vst3_tests.step);\\\\\\\\n    test_step.dependOn(&amp;run_exe_tests.step);\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n    // Just like flags, top level steps are also listed in the &#96;--help&#96; menu.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // The Zig build system is entirely implemented in userland, which means\\\\\\\\n    // that it cannot hook into private compiler APIs. All compilation work\\\\\\\\n    // orchestrated by the build system will result in other Zig compiler\\\\\\\\n    // subcommands being invoked with the right flags defined. You can observe\\\\\\\\n    // these invocations when one fails (or you pass a flag to increase\\\\\\\\n    // verbosity) to validate assumptions and diagnose problems.\\\\\\\\n    //\\\\\\\\n    // Lastly, the Zig build system is relatively simple and self-contained,\\\\\\\\n    // and reading its source code will allow you to master it.\\\\\\\\n}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":172}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"9c220966-47b2-4ac9-a0ae-1b9304a1a075\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"34bfb34d-b6cc-48fa-8a30-a25e08be900d\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-16T20:45:57.897Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\ :[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"pendingToolCalls\\\":[],\\\"turns\\\":[],\\\"previousWorkspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"fileStates\\\":{},\\\"summaryArchives\\\":[],\\\"turnTimings\\\":[],\\\"fileStatesV2\\\":{},\\\"subagentStates\\\":{},\\\"selfSummaryCount\\\":0,\\\"readPaths\\\":[]},\\\"text\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"toolFormerData\\\":{\\\"toolCallId\\\":\\\"tool_04428c47-dca0-404b-912b-5e5c262bb42\\\",\\\"toolIndex\\\":0,\\\"modelCallId\\\":\\\"tool_04428c47-dca0-404b-912b-5e5c262bb42\\\",\\\"status\\\":\\\"completed\\\",\\\"name\\\":\\\"read_file_v2\\\",\\\"rawArgs\\\":\\\"{\\\\\\\"path\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/b/code/z-plug/zig-plug-design.md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"offset\\\\\\\":1,\\\\\\\"limit\\\\\\\":50}\\\",\\\"tool\\\":40,\\\"params\\\":\\\"{\\\\\\\"targetFile\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/b/code/z-plug/zig-plug-design.md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"offset\\\\\\\":1,\\\\\\\"limit\\\\\\\":50,\\\\\\\"charsLimit\\\\\\\":1000000,\\\\\\\"effectiveUri\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/b/code/z-plug/zig-plug-design.md\\\\\\\"}\\\",\\\"result\\\":\\\"{\\\\\\\"contents\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"# High-Level Plan: Zig 0.15.2 Audio Plugin Framework (VST3 + CLAP)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## 1. Project Goals and Design Philosophy\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe framework should let a plugin author write one Zig module â€” defining parameters, audio I/O layout, a &#96;process&#96; function, and optionally a GUI â€” and produce both VST3 and CLAP binaries from the same source. The design takes heavy inspiration from **nih-plug** (Rust), which achieves exactly this by defining an API-agnostic &#96;Plugin&#96; trait and thin format-specific wrappers that translate between the internal trait and the external ABI.[^1][^2]\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCore principles:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- **API-agnostic plugin interface**: the plugin author never touches VST3 or CLAP types directly.\\\\\\\\n- **Comptime-driven metadata**: leverage Zig's comptime to generate vtables, parameter lists, GUIDs, and export symbols at compile time â€” no runtime reflection or code generation needed.[^3]\\\\\\\\n- **No allocations on the audio thread**: the framework must enforce real-time safety by design.\\\\\\\\n- **Minimal magic**: unlike JUCE, prefer explicit over implicit. Similar to nih-plug's philosophy of reducing ceremony while keeping the amount of magic to a minimum.[^1]\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n***\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## 2. Architecture Overview\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe framework has four layers:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\nâ”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”\\\\\\\\nâ”‚              Plugin Author Code              â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”‚   (implements PluginInterface, defines Params)â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤\\\\\\\\nâ”‚            Framework Core Layer              â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”‚  (PluginInterface, Buffer, Events, Params,   â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”‚   ParamSmoother, State, AudioIOLayout)       â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤\\\\\\\\nâ”‚   CLAP Wrapper    â”‚     VST3 Wrapper         â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”‚  (C struct ABI)   â”‚  (COM vtable ABI)        â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤\\\\\\\\nâ”‚          Low-Level Bindings Layer            â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ”‚   clap-zig-bindings    vst3_c_api bindings   â”‚\\\\\\\\nâ””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜\\\\\\\\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### 2.1 Low-Level Bindings\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**CLAP**: Use or fork the existing &#96;clap-zig-bindings&#96; project, which is a complete hand-written idiomatic Zig translation of the CLAP 1.2.2 API. It models all CLAP structs as Zig &#96;extern struct&#96;s with &#96;callconv(.c)&#96; function pointers. Since Zig 0.15.x requires explicit &#96;callconv&#96; on all extern struct function pointer fields, verify the bindings are updated for 0.15.2 (they target 0.13.0 currently, so some adaptation will be needed).[^4][^5][^6]\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**VST3**: Bind against Steinberg's official **VST3 C API** headers (&#96;vst3_c_api&#96;), which provide the entire VST3 interface as C structs with explicit vtable layouts â€” no C++ name mangling. You have two options:[^7]\\\\\\\\n1. Use &#96;@cImport&#96; / &#96;zig translate-c&#96; on the C header to auto-generate Zig bindings (note: comments are not preserved by translate-c).[^3]\\\\\\\\n2. Hand-write the bindings for the ~15 core interfaces, giving you full control over Zig idioms and comptime GUID parsing.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOption 2 is recommended for the core interfaces. The SuperElectric blog post provides an excellent worked example of implementing VST3 COM vtables in Zig with comptime metaprogramming for &#96;FUnknown&#96;/&#96;queryInterface&#96;.[^3]\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Licensing note**: As of October 2025, VST3 moved to MIT licensing, which significantly simplifies redistribution of bindings.[^8]\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### 2.2 Framework Core\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"totalLinesInFile\\\\\\\":372}\\\"},\\\"capabilityType\\\":15}\",\"17ebf756-cf56-4c64-8163-9383dd4feb50\":\"{\\\"_v\\\":3,\\\"type\\\":2,\\\"approximateLintErrors\\\":[],\\\"lints\\\":[],\\\"codebaseContextChunks\\\":[],\\\"commits\\\":[],\\\"pullRequests\\\":[],\\\"attachedCodeChunks\\\":[],\\\"assistantSuggestedDiffs\\\":[],\\\"gitDiffs\\\":[],\\\"interpreterResults\\\":[],\\\"images\\\":[],\\\"attachedFolders\\\":[],\\\"attachedFoldersNew\\\":[],\\\"bubbleId\\\":\\\"3ca7b1f3-74d8-41cd-ab01-9d85673432b5\\\",\\\"userResponsesToSuggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"suggestedCodeBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsForCompressingFiles\\\":[],\\\"relevantFiles\\\":[],\\\"toolResults\\\":[],\\\"notepads\\\":[],\\\"capabilities\\\":[],\\\"multiFileLinterErrors\\\":[],\\\"diffHistories\\\":[],\\\"recentLocationsHistory\\\":[],\\\"recentlyViewedFiles\\\":[],\\\"isAgentic\\\":false,\\\"fileDiffTrajectories\\\":[],\\\"existedSubsequentTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"existedPreviousTerminalCommand\\\":false,\\\"docsReferences\\\":[],\\\"webReferences\\\":[],\\\"aiWebSearchResults\\\":[],\\\"requestId\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"attachedFoldersListDirResults\\\":[],\\\"humanChanges\\\":[],\\\"attachedHumanChanges\\\":false,\\\"summarizedComposers\\\":[],\\\"cursorRules\\\":[],\\\"contextPieces\\\":[],\\\"editTrailContexts\\\":[],\\\"allThinkingBlocks\\\":[],\\\"diffsSinceLastApply\\\":[],\\\"deletedFiles\\\":[],\\\"supportedTools\\\":[],\\\"tokenCount\\\":{\\\"inputTokens\\\":0,\\\"outputTokens\\\":0},\\\"attachedFileCodeChunksMetadataOnly\\\":[],\\\"consoleLogs\\\":[],\\\"uiElementPicked\\\":[],\\\"isRefunded\\\":false,\\\"knowledgeItems\\\":[],\\\"documentationSelections\\\":[],\\\"externalLinks\\\":[],\\\"projectLayouts\\\":[],\\\"unifiedMode\\\":2,\\\"capabilityContexts\\\":[],\\\"todos\\\":[],\\\"createdAt\\\":\\\"2026-02-16T20:45:57.897Z\\\",\\\"mcpDescriptors\\\":[],\\\"workspaceUris\\\":[],\\\"conversationState\\\":{\\\"rootPromptMessagesJson\\\":[],\\\"turnsOld\\\":[],\\\
